The incomplete transformation of Syria's Ahmad al-Sharaa, Islamist rebel turned president
subhed: 'Syria after al-Assad' (1/5). The man who toppled Syria's Baathist regime has succeeded in breaking the country's international isolation. Yet the former jihadist, who governs with a handful of loyal followers, has struggled to defuse the sectarian and ethnic tensions left by the civil war.

title: Trump unveils $12 billion in aid for farmers rocked by tariffs: 'We love our farmers'
subhed: The US president has repeatedly blamed former president Joe Biden for the problems faced by American farmers. But the situation has echoes of Trump's first presidency, when retaliatory tariffs caused over $27 billion in US agriculture export losses from 2018 to 2019.

title: Closure of Madrid's Café Central signals a city in transition
subhed: The iconic Madrid jazz venue is set to close its doors in early 2026. The decision has sparked a strong reaction as the Spanish capital faces rapid gentrification.

title: Cocaine overtakes cannabis as France's most sold drug
subhed: With a value of €3.1 billion compared to €2.7 billion for cannabis, cocaine has become the leading illicit drug market in France, according to a French drugs observatory study.
